7/ https://t.co/58sMHMIUMc

1496238133335232522.text: The bureau within @FTC would employ at least 500 employees, including technologists, constitutional lawyers & experts like child development specialists and statisticians with the expertise needed to equip federal agencies and lawmakers with evidence-based research.

1479160029785866248.text: It started with a viral disinformation campaign to denigrate American democracy and overturn the results of an election during and after the 2020 campaign and continued with 34 attacks on voting rights enacted in 19 states in 2021 alone.

1479160028783423489.text: But, the January 6th attack that left multiple Americans dead and hundreds wounded was not the only assault on our democracy.

1479160027663450112.text: At a fundamental level, all Members of Congress are simply custodians of our office. Our job is to preserve our democracy and pass this government onto the next generation in slightly better condition than we found it.

1479160026635853824.text: There are 535 elected members of Congress. Others have held our jobs before, and if we do our jobs right, someone else will hold them when we go.

1479160025545420803.text: And, 139 of my own colleagues — two-thirds of the House Republican Conference — voted to finish the job the mob attempted to do by force.

1462851617682829315.text: To use a very scientific, technical term — the #BuildBackBetterAct is a big stinking deal for #ClimateAction.

1462851616726528001.text: The #BuildBackBetterAct provides $9 billion in EPA programs for the replacement of lead service lines and the reduction of lead in drinking water systems throughout the country. 6/

1462851615870885891.text: The #BuildBackBetterAct puts $2.9 billion into creating a 21st Century energy grid capable of ensuring the reliable delivery of clean energy throughout the United States. 5/

1462851615132635140.text: The #BuildBackBetterAct invests $40B to incentivize clean energy technology via federal loan guarantees and grants 4/

1462851614235054087.text: The #BuildBackBetterAct establishes a Methane Emissions Reduction Program to control excess methane pollution from the oil and gas industry above specific waste emissions thresholds. 3/

1462851613358448641.text: The #BuildBackBetterAct provides $1 billion in zero-emissions vehicle infrastructure to support the development of an electric vehicle charging network and hydrogen fueling infrastructure to assist the transition to zero-emissions vehicles 2/

1457057421717909504.text: This bill is a win for our infrastructure, a win for #ClimateAction, and a win for Illinoisans.

1457057420514058243.text: Additionally, the bill also provides investments in two key areas I’ve advocated for since I first came to Congress, investing over $505 million for clean energy battery storage and $500 million for research and development in low-carbon industrial technologies.

1457057419553607681.text: Illinois will receive $1.7 billion to improve our water infrastructure, ensuring communities across the state have access to clean, safe drinking water.

1457057418085650437.text: Illinoisans will also benefit from the bill’s historic $3.5 billion national investment in weatherization which will reduce energy costs for families.

1457057417083211780.text:
From 2010 to 2020, Illinois experienced over $50 billion in damage due to extreme weather.

Illinois will receive $27 million to protect against extreme weather and make our infrastructure more resilient.

1457057416131096587.text:
14% of Illinois households do not have an internet subscription.

Illinois will now receive at least $100 million to provide internet access to the 228,000 Illinoisans who currently lack it.

1457057415120175106.text:
If we want to tackle the climate crisis, we have to transition to electric vehicles. This can’t happen if Illinoisans don’t have access to charging stations.

Illinois will receive $149 million to expand our EV charging network.

1457057414113595393.text:
Illinoisans who take public transportation spend an extra 68.3% of their time commuting due to crumbling infrastructure.

Illinois will now receive $4 billion to improve public transportation options across the state.

1457057413144760325.text: In Illinois, there are 2,374 bridges and over 6,218 miles of highway in poor condition. Thanks to this bill, Illinois will receive $9.8 billion for federal-aid highway apportioned programs and $1.4 billion for bridge replacement and repairs.

1457057412142206982.text:
The bipartisan Investment in Infrastructure and Jobs Act provides a historic investment in Illinois. We’ll receive billions of dollars to improve our roads, bridges, airports, broadband, EV charging, and so much more. 

Here’s what this bill will do for Illinois:

1456830096141168650.text: I was also able to secure funding to help decarbonize our economy, including over $505 million for clean energy battery storage to increase the reliability & resilience of the electrical system & $500 million for research and development of low-carbon industrial technologies.

1417547092705300485.text: .@FERC plays a critical role in addressing our energy needs. @SenatorShaheen & @janschakowsky have long emphasized the importance of public participation at @FERC, now I'm declaring a #HotFERCSummer to ensure it has the resources to expedite our transition to a clean energy grid.

1417545411850559489.text: When it comes to a #CleanEnergyEconomy, we don’t talk nearly enough about @FERC. I’m declaring this a #HotFERCSummer to raise awareness on FERC's role in fighting the #ClimateCrisis and the importance of naming a third Democratic commissioner.

1417515275591864325.text: Today, I declared the start of #HotFERCSummer. Why? Well, to paraphrase @theestallion — because now that @FERC has put in all that work, it’s time for them to be the MVP. https://t.co/cVafObTvWR

1417507553785876481.text:
6. Are other Members of Congress trying to capitalize on Hot FERC Summer?

Four of them have already cosponsored #HotFERCSummer bills!

Find your representative at https://t.co/25OgW7wqlO and ask them to join in #HotFERCSummer!

1417507415281577989.text:
5. Is there a Hot Fossil Fuel Summer?

Yeah, that’s canceled.  ❌

1417507258930536450.text:
4. Can I too have a hot FERC summer? 

You already are - you’re reading this on a device that uses electricity, that came to you via markets @FERC has jurisdiction over! Every time you use energy, you’re participating in #HotFERCSummer.

1417506735946928132.text:
3. Why am I not seeing Hot FERC summer everywhere?

#HotFERCSummer is just starting, but it affects everything.

Flipping a light switch and having confidence your light bulb will turn on? That’s #HotFERCSummer! 💡💡
Seeing wind farms and solar panels being built? Yep, that too.

1417506164552749058.text:
2. But, like, what is Hot FERC summer? 🔥

#HotFERCSummer is a celebration of our nation’s regulatory body that has helped us achieve our clean energy goals so far, and one that we need to make sure that @POTUS nominates a new commissioner so it can stay at its full strength. 3/

1417505992477224960.text:

Climate change is the biggest existential threat of our lifetime. An overwhelming majority of Americans want #ClimateAction, so why aren't we doing more?

Because @SenateGOP uses an arcane, Jim Crow era relic to stop the will of a democratically elected majority #EndTheFilibuster

1385252645347151876.text: The filibuster allows a minority of Senators to prevent overwhelmingly popular legislation from becoming law. It is undemocratic and must be abolished #EndTheFilibuster

1385252643577155586.text:
Now, the filibuster is being used by Senate Republicans to prevent:

- Meaningful action on climate change

- Voting rights legislation

- Steps to curb gun violence

1385252640838279169.text: In 1917, the filibuster was first used by white supremacists to prevent a bill that would have made lynching a crime. In the Jim Crow era, the filibuster was only used to block civil rights legislation.

1385252639626121223.text:
The rules in the Senate are the same as they are in the House. In order to pass a bill, a simple majority must vote in favor of the bill.
 
Where the Senate differs is that, with the filibuster, you need a supermajority to even bring a bill to a vote.

1385252638577598464.text: It’s time to #EndTheFilibuster. It’s an arcane, Jim Crow era relic that is preventing a democratically elected majority from passing overwhelmingly popular legislation on a range of issues.

1385244520170807300.text:
Republicans proposed at least 250 voting restriction laws at the state level. Georgia has already passed a voter suppression bill.

H.R. 1 is waiting to be passed in the Senate & it would protect our right to vote. 

This is an urgent crisis. We must #EndTheFilibuster & pass it.
